name: src/document.js
TextDocument
description:
A plain text document that can be mutated (or modified).

To mutate a document, you must first add parsers which will identify elements in the text, using {@link TextDocument#addParser} or {@link TextDocument#buildParser}.

Parsers must be generator functions which parse the document and yield the text elements they identify.
These elements must be subclasses of {@link TextElement} and must be yielded in the order they are found in the document.
If the element needs to be mutated, its subclass must know how to modify its own text or the document to obtain the desired end result.
See {@link ParserBuilder} for an example of how to create a parser.

When you have added all the parsers you need, call {@link TextDocument#mutate}.
This will trigger the parsing, then mutate each element one by one until the end of the document has been reached.

## Events

A text document is an {@link events~EventEmitter} that emits the following events:

* `element` - Emitted after calling {@link TextDocument#mutate} while the parsing is in progress, for each new element identified by a parser.
  The parsed {@link TextElement} is provided to listeners.
* `parsed` - Emitted after calling {@link TextDocument#mutate} when parsing the document is complete.
* `mutate` - Emitted after calling {@link TextDocument#mutate} while the document is being mutated, once for each element that triggered a mutation.
  The {@link TextMutation} object describing the change is provided to listeners.

name: constructor
description: Creates a text document.

params.name: text
params.description: The document's text.

name: text
description: The document's text.

name: parsers
description: The document's parsers.

name: elements
description: The {@link TextElement} objects identified in the document by the parsers.

name: addParser
description:
Adds a parser for this document.

Parsers will be invoked when calling {@link TextDocument#mutate}.

params.name: parser
params.description: A generator function that yields {@link TextElement} objects in order, or a function that returns an ordered array of parsed {@link TextElement} objects.

name: buildParser
description:
Returns a parser builder for this document.
Any argument is passed to the builder's constructor as additional arguments after this document.

The returned builder will add a parser to this document when calling {@link ParserBuilder#add}.

unknown.tagValue: {ParserBuilder} A parser builder for this document.

return.description: A parser builder for this document.

name: addElement
description:
Adds a text element to this document.

The element must not overlap any other element already present in the document.

params.name: element
params.description: The text element to add.

name: removeElement
description: Removes the specified element from this document.

params.name: element
params.description: The element to remove.

name: mutate
description:
Mutates this document.

This is done in two steps:

1. All parsers will be invoked and used to parse the entire document.
2. All identified text elements will be mutated one by one in order.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<TextDocument>} A promise that will be resolved when the mutation is complete.

return.description: A promise that will be resolved when the mutation is complete.

name: append
description: Performs a text element mutation that appends text at the end of this document.

params.name: element
params.description: The element that triggered the mutation.

params.name: text
params.description: The text to append.

name: prepend
description: Performs a text element mutation that prepends text to the beginning of this document.

params.name: element
params.description: The element that triggered the mutation.

params.name: text
params.description: The text to prepend.

name: insert
description: Performs a text element mutation that inserts additional text into the document.

params.name: element
params.description: The element that triggered the mutation.

params.name: index
params.description: The index at which to insert the text.

params.name: text
params.description: The text to insert.

name: replace
description: Performs a text element mutation that replaces part of the text in this document by another text.

params.name: element
params.description: The element that triggered the mutation.

params.name: start
params.description: The start index (inclusive) of the text range to replace.

params.name: end
params.description: The end index (exclusive) of the text range to replace.

params.name: text
params.description: The text to replace the selected range with.

name: remove
description: Performs a text element mutation that removes the element from the document.

params.name: element
params.description: The element that triggered the mutation.

params.name: start
params.description: The start index (inclusive) of the text range to remove.

params.name: end
params.description: The end index (exclusive) of the text range to remove.

name: find
description: Finds the first text element in this document that matches the specified conditions.

unknown.tagValue: {TextElement|undefined} The first element matching the predicate, or `undefined`.

params.name: predicate
params.description: A function that will be passed each element and should return true if the element matches the desired conditions.

return.description: The first element matching the predicate, or `undefined`.

name: findLast
description: Finds the last text element in this document that matches the specified conditions.

unknown.tagValue: {TextElement|undefined} The last element matching the predicate, or `undefined`.

params.name: predicate
params.description: A function that will be passed each element and should return true if the element matches the desired conditions.

return.description: The last element matching the predicate, or `undefined`.

name: findNext
description: Finds the first text element after the specified element in this document that matches the specified conditions.

unknown.tagValue: {TextElement|undefined} The last element matching the predicate, or `undefined`.

params.name: element
params.description: The element after which to search.

params.name: predicate
params.description: A function that will be passed each element and should return true if the element matches the desired conditions.

return.description: The last element matching the predicate, or `undefined`.

name: findPrevious
description: Finds the last text element before the specified element in this document that matches the specified conditions.

unknown.tagValue: {TextElement|undefined} The last element matching the predicate, or `undefined`.

params.name: element
params.description: The element before which to search.

params.name: predicate
params.description: A function that will be passed each element and should return true if the element matches the desired conditions.

return.description: The last element matching the predicate, or `undefined`.

name: src/element.configurable.js
ConfigurableTextElement
description: A text element that has a configurable behavior.

name: constructor
description:
Creates a text element with arbitrary data which can be used at mutation time.

Also calls the `this.initializer` function attached to this element, if any.

params.name: document
params.description: The document in which the element was found or is to be inserted.

params.name: start
params.description: The index at which the element's text is found in the document.

params.name: text
params.description: The element's text.

params.name: data
params.description: Data to attach to the element.

name: data
description: Arbitrary data that will be available at mutation time.

name: mutate
description: Calls the `this.mutator` function attached to this element, if any.

name: toStringProperties
description: Returns a string representing this element.

name: src/element.js
TextElement
description:
A text element is a part of a {@link TextDocument} that can be mutated.

It is identified by its start (inclusive) and end (exclusive) indices in the document.
Text elements are identified when parsing a {@link TextDocument}.

For example, take the following Markdown document:

```md
# Documentation

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.

## Usage

Consectetur adipiscing elit.
Maecenas laoreet hendrerit felis eget vulputate.

### Requirements

* Aenean quis felis lacus.
* Proin lobortis, mauris at congue lacinia.
* Erat arcu cursus diam.
```

A parser for Markdown headers could identify the following text elements:

* `# Documentation` starting at index 0 and ending at index 15.
* `## Usage` starting at index 46 and ending at index 54.
* `### Requirements` starting at index 135 and ending at index 151.

By using a subclass of `TextElement`, the parser might also store additional information
about the elements, such as the titles' contents or level in this case.

name: constructor
description: Creates a text element for the specified document.

params.name: document
params.description: The document in which the element was found or is to be inserted.

params.name: start
params.description: The index at which the element's text is found in the document.

params.name: text
params.description: The element's text.

name: document
description: The document in which this text element is located.

name: text
description: This element's text.

name: mutate
description:
Mutates this element's text.

This is an empty implementation which should be overridden in subclasses.
The supplied {@link TextDocument} has many utility methods to insert, modify or remove text.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise|undefined} A promise which will be resolved when the mutation is complete, or nothing if the mutation was synchronous.

return.description: A promise which will be resolved when the mutation is complete, or nothing if the mutation was synchronous.

name: append
description:
Appends text after this element.

Utility method for use in {@link TextElement#mutate}.

params.name: text
params.description: The text to append.

name: prepend
description:
Prepends text before this element.
The text is not included into the element. Rather, the element is moved forward in the document to take into account the added text.

Utility method for use in {@link TextElement#mutate}.

params.name: text
params.description: The text to prepend.

name: replace
description:
Replaces this element's text by another text.

Utility method for use in {@link TextElement#mutate}.

params.name: text
params.description: The new text.

name: remove
description:
Removes this element's text from the document.

This will also remove the element from the document's list of elements,
and remove all of this elements' listeners registered with {@link TextElement#onDocument}.

Utility method for use in {@link TextElement#mutate}.

name: onDocument
description:
Registers a listener on a document event.

Listeners registered with this method can later be removed with {@link TextElement#removeDocumentListeners}.

params.name: event
params.description: The name of the event to listen to.

params.name: listener
params.description: The callback function.

params.name: context
params.description: The context to which the callback function will be bound (`this` by default).

name: removeDocumentListeners
description: Unregisters listeners on document events.

params.name: event
params.description: If specified, all the listeners for that event will be unregistered. Otherwise, all listeners for all events will be unregistered.

name: onDocumentMutated
description:
Called when this element's document is mutated.
If the mutation took place before this element in the text, this method
automatically moves the element's start and end indices by the correct amount.

If the mutation concerns this element, this method does nothing
(it is the responsibility of elements to mutate themselves; this method
only reacts to the mutation of other elements).

params.name: mutation
params.description: The mutation that occurred.

name: toString
description: Returns a string representing this element.

name: toStringProperties
description: Returns the properties that will be serialized in {@link TextElement#toString}.

name: src/index.js
src/mutation.js
TextMutation
description:
A change in a text document.

This is an abstract class that does nothing.
It should be subclasses and its methods overriden.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new text mutation concerning the specified text element.

params.name: element
params.description: The text element being mutated.

name: element
description: The text element being mutated.

name: start
description:
The start index at which this mutation takes place in the text document.

If the mutation affects an existing range of text, this must be the start index (inclusive) of that range.
If the mutation only adds new text, this must be the index at which that text will be inserted.

unknown.tagValue: {integer} The index at which this mutation takes place in the text document.

return.description: The index at which this mutation takes place in the text document.

name: end
description:
The end index at which this mutation takes place in the text document.

If the mutation affects an existing range of text, this must be the end index (exclusive) of that range.
If the mutation only adds new text, this must be `undefined`.

unknown.tagValue: {integer|undefined} The end index (exclusive) of the existing text range affected by this mutation, or `undefined` if the mutation only adds new text.

return.description: The end index (exclusive) of the existing text range affected by this mutation, or `undefined` if the mutation only adds new text.

name: delta
description:
The positive or negative difference of the total length of the text document after the mutation is applied.

* If the mutation adds 3 characters, the delta is 3.
* If the mutation adds 5 characters and removes 7, the delta is -2.

unknown.tagValue: {integer} The number of characters added to or removed from the document by this mutation.

return.description: The number of characters added to or removed from the document by this mutation.

name: apply
description: Applies this mutation to the specified text.

params.name: text
params.description: The text to change.

name: src/mutation.splice.js
SpliceTextMutation
description: A text mutation that removes and/or adds characters at a specific index in a text, much like `Array.prototype.splice` does for arrays.

name: constructor
description: Creates a splice mutation.

params.name: element
params.description: The text element being mutated.

params.name: index
params.description: The index in the text document at which to remove and/or add characters.

params.name: removeCount
params.description: How many characters to remove at the specified index (can be 0).

params.name: textToAdd
params.description: The text to add at the specified index (can be omitted if you only need to remove text).

name: index
description: The index in the text document at which to remove and/or add characters.

name: removeCount
description: How many characters to remove at the specified index.

name: textToAdd
description: The text to add at the specified index.

name: start
description: Returns the index at which splicing takes place in the text document.

unknown.tagValue: {integer} The index at which splicing takes place.

return.description: The index at which splicing takes place.

name: end
description: Returns the end index (exclusive) of the text range removed by the mutation, if any.

unknown.tagValue: {integer|undefined} The end index (exclusive) of the text range removed by the mutation, or `undefined` if it only adds new text.

return.description: The end index (exclusive) of the text range removed by the mutation, or `undefined` if it only adds new text.

name: delta
description: Returns the difference between the length of the added text and the number of removed characters.

unknown.tagValue: {integer} The number of characters added to or removed from the document by this mutation.

return.description: The number of characters added to or removed from the document by this mutation.

name: apply
description: Applies this mutation to the specified text.

params.name: text
params.description: The text to change.

name: src/parser-builder.js
ParserBuilder
description:
A chainable builder to add a text parser to a {@link TextDocument}.

{@link TextDocument} parsers are generator functions that must return {@link TextElement} objects, usually a subclass.
This builder simplifies making such a function.

name: constructor
description: Creates a builder that will add a parser to the specified document.

params.name: document
params.description: The document to add the parser to.

params.name: type
params.description:
An optional type that will be set on parsed {@link TextElement} objects.
This can be useful to distinguish between different element types since all elements parsed by this build's parser will be instances of the same {@link TextElement} subclass.

name: document
description: The document to which this builder will add parsers.

name: type
description: The type of parsed {@link TextElement} objects.

name: regexp
description:
Configures the parser to look for text elements matching the specified regular expression in the document.

The regular expression can have the global flag or not, depending on whether you need to parse a single or multiple elements.

params.name: regexp
params.description: The regular expression to use to find text elements.

name: elementType
description:
Sets the type that will be set on parsed {@link TextElement} objects.

This overrides the type supplied to the constructor.

params.name: type
params.description: The type to set on parsed {@link TextElement} objects.

name: initialize
description:
Sets the initializer function that will be invoked for each parsed {@link TextElement} object.
It will be bound to the parsed object.

params.name: initializer
params.description: An initializer function.

name: mutate
description:
Sets the mutator function that will be invoked when each parsed {@link TextElement} object is mutated.
It will be bound to the parsed object.

params.name: mutator
params.description: A mutator function.

name: add
description: Adds the configured parser to this builder's document.

name: src/range.js
TextRange
description: A range of text, defined by a start and end indices.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new text range.

params.name: start
params.description: The start index (inclusive) of this range.

params.name: end
params.description: The end index (exclusive) of this range.

name: start
description: The start index (inclusive) of this range.

name: end
description: The end index (exclusive) of this range.

name: overlaps
description: Indicates whether the specified range overlaps with this one.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} True if the specified range overlaps with this one, false otherwise.

params.name: range
params.description: The range to check.

return.description: True if the specified range overlaps with this one, false otherwise.

name: moveBy
description: Moves this range by the specified number of characters.

params.name: delta
params.description: The value to add or remove to this range's start and end indices.

name: extractFromText
description: Returns the contents of this range within the specified text.

params.name: text
params.description: The text from which to extract this range.

name: isInText
description: Indicates whether this range exists within the specified text.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} True if this range fits within the bounds of the text, false otherwise.

params.name: text
params.description: The text in which to check.

return.description: True if this range fits within the bounds of the text, false otherwise.

name: src/utils.js
